means: sleep ： 普通用词，指一般的睡眠。可用作引申指长眠或静止不动。
doze ： 多用于口语中，指轻微的小睡或处于半睡状态。
slumber ： 多指人安详地或长时间地睡。

sentence.Network_en: She fell into a deep and peaceful slumber.
sentence.Network_cn: 她睡着了，睡得又沉又香。

sentence.Network_en: All the people in the hotels were wrapped in deep slumber.
sentence.Network_cn: 住在各旅馆里的人都已进入梦乡.

sentence.Network_en: He had fallen into exhausted slumber.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: alteration of Scots and northern English sloom, in the same sense. The -b- was added for ease of pronunciation

example.ex: He had fallen into exhausted slumber...
He roused Charles from his slumbers.
example.tran: 他把查尔斯从睡梦中叫醒。

means.word_mean: 1. a natural and periodic state of rest during which consciousness of the world is suspended;

sentences.sentence: "he didn't get enough sleep last night"
"calm as a child in dreamless slumber"
